thread.title: CNN Reporter Flees Live On-Air as Police Disperse Crowd at Protest Against Milo Yiannopoulos
thread.title_full: CNN Reporter Flees Live On-Air as Police Disperse Crowd at Protest Against Milo Yiannopoulos

author: Justin Baragona
title: CNN Reporter Flees Live On-Air as Police Disperse Crowd at Protest Against Milo Yiannopoulos
text:
CNN Reporter Flees Live On-Air as Police Disperse Crowd at Protest Against Milo Yiannopoulos by Justin Baragona | 9:36 pm, February 1st, 2017 Video 
A protest broke out at the UC Berkeley campus in California this evening over a speech that was scheduled to be held by notorious conservative provocateur and Breitbart editor Milo Yiannopoulos . 
Shortly after CNN patched in live to the action, with host Anderson Cooper asking reporter Kyung Lah what’s going on, Lah was forced to run as the police tried to disperse the crowd. 
A loud flashbang could be heard and Lah and her cameraman began running away, with Lah shouting “Watch out!” 
Watch the clip above, via CNN. 
[image via screengrab]
